question: Which of the following commissions appointed by the British Government abolished the statutory civil service and recommended a Provincial Civil Service in 1888?
option3: Royal commission on the Superior Civil Services in India
explanation: In the year 1886, Aitchison Commission was appointed. Sir Charles Umpherston Aitchison was the chairman of the committee. The objective of the committee was to fulfill the demand of Indians to higher and more extensive employment in public service. As per the recommendation of the committee, the statutory civil service was abolished and it recommended a Provincial Civil Service in 1888.
